commands.name: az storage share close-handle
commands.summary: Close file handles of a file share.
commands.syntax:
az storage share close-handle --name
                              [--account-key]
                              [--account-name]
                              [--auth-mode {key, login}]
                              [--backup-intent]
                              [--close-all {false, true}]
                              [--connection-string]
                              [--disallow-trailing-dot {false, true}]
                              [--file-endpoint]
                              [--handle-id]
                              [--path]
                              [--recursive {false, true}]
                              [--sas-token]
                              [--snapshot]
                              [--timeout]
examples:
az storage share close-handle --account-name MyAccount --name MyFileShare --close-all --recursive
az storage share close-handle --account-name MyAccount --name MyFileShare --handle-id "*" --recursive
az storage share close-handle --account-name MyAccount --name MyFileShare --path 'dir1' --close-all --recursive
az storage share close-handle --account-name MyAccount --name MyFileShare --path 'dir1/test.txt' --close-all
az storage share close-handle --account-name MyAccount --name MyFileShare --path 'dir1/test.txt' --handle-id "id"

commands.name: az storage share close-handle
commands.summary: Close file handles of a file share.
commands.syntax:
az storage share close-handle --name
                              [--account-key]
                              [--account-name]
                              [--auth-mode {key, login}]
                              [--backup-intent]
                              [--close-all {false, true}]
                              [--connection-string]
                              [--disallow-trailing-dot {false, true}]
                              [--handle-id]
                              [--path]
                              [--recursive {false, true}]
                              [--sas-token]
                              [--snapshot]
                              [--timeout]
examples:
az storage share close-handle --account-name MyAccount --name MyFileShare --close-all --recursive
az storage share close-handle --account-name MyAccount --name MyFileShare --handle-id "*" --recursive
az storage share close-handle --account-name MyAccount --name MyFileShare --path 'dir1' --close-all --recursive
az storage share close-handle --account-name MyAccount --name MyFileShare --path 'dir1/test.txt' --close-all
az storage share close-handle --account-name MyAccount --name MyFileShare --path 'dir1/test.txt' --handle-id "id"

commands.name: az storage share create
commands.summary: Creates a new share under the specified account.
examples: az storage share create --account-name MyAccount --name MyFileShare

commands.name: az storage share delete
commands.summary: Mark the specified share for deletion.

commands.name: az storage share exists
commands.summary: Check for the existence of a file share.
examples: az storage share exists --account-key 00000000 --account-name MyAccount --name MyFileShare
az storage share exists --connection-string $connectionString --name MyFileShare

commands.name: az storage share generate-sas
commands.summary: Generate a shared access signature for the share.
examples:
end=`date -u -d "30 minutes" '+%Y-%m-%dT%H:%MZ'`
sas=`az storage share generate-sas -n MyShare --account-name MyStorageAccount --https-only --permissions dlrw --expiry $end -o tsv`
az storage file upload -s MyShare --account-name MyStorageAccount --source file.txt  --sas-token $sas
az storage share generate-sas --account-key 00000000 --account-name MyStorageAccount --expiry 2037-12-31T23:59:00Z --name MyShare --permissions dlrw
az storage share generate-sas --connection-string $connectionString --expiry 2019-02-01T12:20Z --name MyShare --permissions dlrw

commands.name: az storage share list
commands.summary: List the file shares in a storage account.

commands.name: az storage share list-handle
commands.summary: List file handles of a file share.
commands.syntax:
az storage share list-handle --name
                             [--account-key]
                             [--account-name]
                             [--auth-mode {key, login}]
                             [--backup-intent]
                             [--connection-string]
                             [--disallow-trailing-dot {false, true}]
                             [--file-endpoint]
                             [--marker]
                             [--max-results]
                             [--path]
                             [--recursive {false, true}]
                             [--sas-token]
                             [--snapshot]
                             [--timeout]
examples: az storage share list-handle --account-name MyAccount --name MyFileShare --recursive
az storage share list-handle --account-name MyAccount --name MyFileShare --path 'dir1' --recursive
az storage share list-handle --account-name MyAccount --name MyFileShare --path 'dir1/test.txt'

commands.name: az storage share list-handle
commands.summary: List file handles of a file share.
commands.syntax:
az storage share list-handle --name
                             [--account-key]
                             [--account-name]
                             [--auth-mode {key, login}]
                             [--backup-intent]
                             [--connection-string]
                             [--disallow-trailing-dot {false, true}]
                             [--marker]
                             [--max-results]
                             [--path]
                             [--recursive {false, true}]
                             [--sas-token]
                             [--snapshot]
                             [--timeout]
examples: az storage share list-handle --account-name MyAccount --name MyFileShare --recursive
az storage share list-handle --account-name MyAccount --name MyFileShare --path 'dir1' --recursive
az storage share list-handle --account-name MyAccount --name MyFileShare --path 'dir1/test.txt'

commands.name: az storage share show
commands.summary: Return all user-defined metadata and system properties for the specified share.

commands.name: az storage share snapshot
commands.summary: Create a snapshot of an existing share under the specified account.

commands.name: az storage share stats
commands.summary: Get the approximate size of the data stored on the share, rounded up to the nearest gigabyte.

commands.name: az storage share update
commands.summary: Set service-defined properties for the specified share.

commands.name: az storage share url
commands.summary: Create a URI to access a file share.
examples: az storage share url --account-key 00000000 --account-name MyAccount --name MyFileShare
